## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
AI Assistant: Hello there! I'm here to assist you with your questions. Please, feel free to ask anything.
User: I was trying to update my wallet, but I realized I'm on my own fork. In which three steps can one follow to update their wallet and efficiently rectify the problem caused by being on their own fork?
AI Assistant: To resolve the issue, you should follow these steps: (1) Stopping the wallet/mining process by cleanly shutting down the program, (2) updating your wallet if necessary, and (3) following the procedure in [HOW-TO Backup, Install or Update and Bootstrap your wallet.md](#!how-to/how-to_bootstrap.md) to efficiently rectify the problem.

User: Thanks for that. I'm also curious about what are the two main solutions to resolving a situation where one is on their own fork due to a network issue or having an old version of the wallet?
AI Assistant: The two solutions are (1) to simply install the latest bootstrap file, which requires less work but involves a large download, or (2) to search manually for the forked block and invalidate that block, which although is time-consuming, does not require any additional download.

User: What should one do if it seems that their mining rewards suddenly seem to come to a halt, after following the procedures to solve a situation of being on their own fork because of a network issue or having an old version of the wallet?
AI Assistant: If it seems that your mining rewards suddenly seem to come to a halt, one should remember that when you mine to the wrong chain, the rewards can come in very quickly, but they are worth nothing. Therefore, there is no need to be dismayed; just continue with the appropriate backup, installation, or update procedures.

User: Which terminal does one use when carrying out the Verus-Desktop Procedure 2?
AI Assistant: When carrying out the Verus-Desktop Procedure 2, the commands are all entered in the *Native Client Terminal*. This terminal can be accessed under `Settings`, `Coin Settings`. Do you have any more questions about Verus-Desktop Procedures?

In which three steps can one follow to update their wallet and efficiently rectify the problem caused by being on their own fork?

The procedure to follow involves: (1Stopping the wallet/mining process by cleanly shutting down the program, (2) updating your wallet if necessary, and (3) following the procedure in [HOW-TO Backup, Install or Update and Bootstrap your wallet.md](#!how-to/how-to_bootstrap.md) to efficiently rectify the problem.

# Question: What should I do if I end up on my own fork because of a network issue or having an old version of the wallet? This solution can be solved in 2 ways: you can simply install the latest bootstrap file (less work, big download) or search manually for the forked block and invalidate that block (time-consuming, no download needed.) ## Procedure 1 (Easy, installing bootstrap) For all GUI or CLI users. 1. Stop the wallet/mining process by cleanly shutting down the program. 2. Update your wallet if necessary. 3. Follow the procedure in [HOW-TO Backup, Install or Update and Bootstrap your wallet.md](#!how-to/how-to_bootstrap.md) to efficiently rectify the problem. 4. Do not be dismayed if it seems that your mining rewards suddenly seem to come to a halt. Remember, when you mine to the wrong chain rewards can come in very quickly, but they are worth nothing. ## Procedure 2 (Time consuming, no extra download) ### Verus-Desktop 1. The commands are **all** entered in the *Native Client Terminal* that is located under `Settings`, `Coin Settings`. 2.

What are the two main solutions to resolving a situation where one is on their own fork due to a network issue or having an old version of the wallet?

The two solutions are (1to simply install the latest bootstrap file, which requires less work but involves a large download, or (2) to search manually for the forked block and invalidate that block, which although is time-consuming, does not require any additional download.

What should one do if it seems that their mining rewards suddenly seem to come to a halt, after following the procedures to solve a situation of being on their own fork because of a network issue or having an old version of the wallet?

If it seems that your mining rewards suddenly seem to come to a halt, one should remember that when you mine to the wrong chain, the rewards can come in very quickly, but they are worth nothing. Therefore, there is no need to be dismayed; just continue with the appropriate backup, installation, or update procedures.
